SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jhove2.module.assess
Class Rule

java.lang.Object
  org.jhove2.module.assess.Rule

@Persistent
public class Rule
extends Object

The container for a rule specification. A rule is evaluated against the ReportableProperty(s) of a object such as a FormatModule or Source object instance. This specification uses an if-then-else construct whose basic structure (in pseudocode form) looks like this: 

    If (condition) Then 
       (consequent)
    Else
       (alternative)
    End If
The condition portion of the rule consists of a quantifier and a list of predicate expressions looking like this: 
    {ALL_OFF | ANY_OF | NONE_OF} 
       (predicate)
       (predicate)
        ...
Each predicate is a string containing a boolean expression written using a domain specific language. Currently only MVEL is supported. The expression is usually of the form: 
    {reportableProperty} {logical operator} {value}
If the ALL_OF quantifier is specified (the default), then all of the predicates must evaluate to true for the rule as a whole to be true. If the ANY_OF quantifier is specified, then the rule will evaluate to true if any of the predicates are true. If the NONE_OF quantifier is specified, then the rule will evaluate to true if all of the predicates are false. In addition to the boolean value of the rule evaluation, A text value will be included in the assessment result's outcome. This text value will be the consequent string value if the rule is true, else the alternative string will be used.

Author:
rnanders
See Also:
Conditional (programming) - Wikipedia, The IF-THEN-ELSE Construct, Predicates and Quantifiers, MVEL - Home, MVEL Language Guide
